017package org.apache.commons.chain.web;
018
019import java.io.InputStream;
020import java.net.URL;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.Iterator;
023import java.util.Set;
024
025import javax.servlet.ServletContext;
026import javax.servlet.ServletContextEvent;
027import javax.servlet.ServletContextListener;
028
029import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
030import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
031import org.apache.commons.chain.config.ConfigParser;
032import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase;
033import org.apache.commons.digester.RuleSet;
034import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
035import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
036
037/**
038 * {@code ServletContextListener} that automatically
039 * scans chain configuration files in the current web application at
040 * startup time, and exposes the result in a {@link Catalog} under a
041 * specified servlet context attribute. The following <em>context</em> init
042 * parameters are utilized:
043 * <ul>
044 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE</strong> -
045 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration resources to be loaded
046 *     via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()} calls. If not specified,
047 *     no class loader resources will be loaded.</li>
048 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE</strong> -
049 *     comma-delimited list of chain configuration webapp resources
050 *     to be loaded. If not specified, no web application resources
051 *     will be loaded.</li>
052 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_ATTR</strong> -
053 *     Name of the servlet context attribute under which the
054 *     resulting {@link Catalog} will be created or updated.
055 *     If not specified, it is expected that parsed resources will
056 *     contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements (which will
057 *     cause registration of the created {@link Catalog}s into
058 *     the {@link CatalogFactory} for this application, and no
059 *     servet context attribute will be created.
060 *     <strong>NOTE</strong> - This parameter is deprecated.</li>
061 * <li><strong>org.apache.commons.chain.RULE_SET</strong> -
062 *     Fully qualified class name of a Digester {@code RuleSet}
063 *     implementation to use for parsing configuration resources (this
064 *     class must have a public zero-args constructor). If not defined,
065 *     the standard {@code RuleSet} implementation will be used.</li>
066 * </ul>
067 *
068 * <p>When a web application that has configured this listener is
069 * started, it will acquire the {@link Catalog} under the specified servlet
070 * context attribute key, creating a new one if there is none already there.
071 * This {@link Catalog} will then be populated by scanning configuration
072 * resources from the following sources (loaded in this order):</p>
073 * <ul>
074 * <li>Resources loaded from any {@code META-INF/chain-config.xml}
075 *     resource found in a JAR file in {@code /WEB-INF/lib}.</li>
076 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths from the
077 *     webapp's class loader (via {@code ClassLoader.getResource()}).</li>
078 * <li>Resources loaded from specified resource paths in the web application
079 *     archive (via {@code ServetContext.getResource()}).</li>
080 * </ul>
081 *
082 * <p>If no attribute key is specified, on the other hand, parsed configuration
083 * resources are expected to contain {@code &lt;catalog&gt;} elements,
084 * and the catalogs will be registered with the {@link CatalogFactory}
085 * for this web application.</p>
086 *
087 * <p>This class requires Servlet 2.3 or later. If you are running on
088 * Servlet 2.2 system, consider using {@link ChainServlet} instead.
089 * Note that {@link ChainServlet} uses parameters of the
090 * same names, but they are <em>servlet</em> init parameters instead
091 * of <em>context</em> init parameters. Because of this, you can use
092 * both facilities in the same application, if desired.</p>
093 *
094 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
095 * @author Ted Husted
096 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
097 */
098public class ChainListener implements ServletContextListener {
099
100    // ------------------------------------------------------ Manifest Constants
101
102    /**
103     * The name of the context init parameter containing the name of the
104     * servlet context attribute under which our resulting {@link Catalog}
105     * will be stored.
106     */
107    public static final String CONFIG_ATTR =
108        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_ATTR";
109
110    /**
111     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
112     * list of class loader resources to be scanned.
113     */
114    public static final String CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE =
115        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE";
116
117    /**
118     * The name of the context init parameter containing a comma-delimited
119     * list of web applicaton resources to be scanned.
120     */
121    public static final String CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE =
122        "org.apache.commons.chain.CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE";
123
124    /**
125     * The name of the context init parameter containing the fully
126     * qualified class name of the {@code RuleSet} implementation
127     * for configuring our {@link ConfigParser}.
128     */
129    public static final String RULE_SET =
130        "org.apache.commons.chain.RULE_SET";
131
132    // ------------------------------------------ ServletContextListener Methods
133
134    /**
135     * Remove the configured {@link Catalog} from the servlet context
136     * attributes for this web application.
137     *
138     * @param event {@code ServletContextEvent} to be processed
139     */
140    @Override
141    public void contextDestroyed(ServletContextEvent event) {
142        ServletContext context = event.getServletContext();
143        String attr = context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR);
144        if (attr != null) {
145            context.removeAttribute(attr);
146        }
147        CatalogFactory.clear();
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Scan the required chain configuration resources, assemble the
152     * configured chains into a {@link Catalog}, and expose it as a
153     * servlet context attribute under the specified key.
154     *
155     * @param event {@code ServletContextEvent} to be processed
156     */
157    @Override
158    @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
159    public void contextInitialized(ServletContextEvent event) {
160        Log log = LogFactory.getLog(ChainListener.class);
161        if (log.isInfoEnabled()) {
162            log.info("Initializing chain listener");
163        }
164        ServletContext context = event.getServletContext();
165
166        // Retrieve context init parameters that we need
167        String attr = context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_ATTR);
168        String classResources =
169            context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_CLASS_RESOURCE);
170        String ruleSet = context.getInitParameter(RULE_SET);
171        String webResources = context.getInitParameter(CONFIG_WEB_RESOURCE);
172
173        // Retrieve or create the Catalog instance we may be updating
174        Catalog<?> catalog = null;
175        if (attr != null) {
176            catalog = (Catalog<?>) context.getAttribute(attr);
177            if (catalog == null) {
178                catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
179            }
180        }
181
182        // Construct the configuration resource parser we will use
183        ConfigParser parser = new ConfigParser();
184        if (ruleSet != null) {
185            try {
186                ClassLoader loader =
187                    Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
188                if (loader == null) {
189                    loader = this.getClass().getClassLoader();
190                }
191                Class<? extends RuleSet> clazz = loader
192                        .loadClass(ruleSet)
193                        .asSubclass(RuleSet.class);
194                parser.setRuleSet(clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance());
195            } catch (Exception e) {
196                throw new RuntimeException("Exception initalizing RuleSet '"
197                                           + ruleSet + "' instance: "
198                                           + e.getMessage());
199            }
200        }
201
202        // Parse the resources specified in our init parameters (if any)
203        if (attr == null) {
204            parseJarResources(context, parser, log);
205            ChainResources.parseClassResources(classResources, parser);
206            ChainResources.parseWebResources(context, webResources, parser);
207        } else {
208            parseJarResources(catalog, context, parser, log);
209            ChainResources.parseClassResources(catalog, classResources, parser);
210            ChainResources.parseWebResources(catalog, context, webResources, parser);
211        }
212
213        // Expose the completed catalog (if requested)
214        if (attr != null) {
215            context.setAttribute(attr, catalog);
216        }
217    }
218
219    // --------------------------------------------------------- Private Methods
220
221    /**
222     * Parse resources found in JAR files in the {@code /WEB-INF/lib}
223     * subdirectory (if any).
224     *
225     * @param context {@code ServletContext} for this web application
226     * @param parser {@link ConfigParser} to use for parsing
227     * @param log to use for logging
228     */
229    private void parseJarResources(ServletContext context,
230                                   ConfigParser parser, Log log) {
231
232        Set<?> jars = context.getResourcePaths("/WEB-INF/lib");
233        if (jars == null) {
234            jars = Collections.emptySet();
235        }
236        String path = null;
237        Iterator<?> paths = jars.iterator();
238        while (paths.hasNext()) {
239
240            path = paths.next().toString();
241            if (!path.endsWith(".jar")) {
242                continue;
243            }
244            URL resourceURL = null;
245            try {
246                URL jarURL = context.getResource(path);
247                resourceURL = new URL("jar:"
248                                      + translate(jarURL.toExternalForm())
249                                      + "!/META-INF/chain-config.xml");
250                InputStream is = null;
251                try {
252                    is = resourceURL.openStream();
253                } catch (Exception e) {
254                      // means there is no such resource
255                }
256                if (is == null) {
257                    if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
258                        log.debug("Not Found: " + resourceURL);
259                    }
260                    continue;
261                } else {
262                    is.close();
263                }
264                if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
265                    log.debug("Parsing: " + resourceURL);
266                }
267                parser.parse(resourceURL);
268            } catch (Exception e) {
269                throw new RuntimeException("Exception parsing chain config resource '"
270                     + resourceURL.toExternalForm() + "': "
271                     + e.getMessage());
272            }
273        }
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Parse resources found in JAR files in the {@code /WEB-INF/lib}
278     * subdirectory (if any).
279     *
280     * @param catalog {@link Catalog} we are populating
281     * @param context {@code ServletContext} for this web application
282     * @param parser {@link ConfigParser} to use for parsing
283     * @param log to use for logging
284     *
285     * @deprecated Use the variant that does not take a catalog, on a
286     *  configuration resource containing "catalog" element(s)
287     */
288    @Deprecated
289    private void parseJarResources(Catalog<?> catalog, ServletContext context,
290                                   ConfigParser parser, Log log) {
291
292        Set<?> jars = context.getResourcePaths("/WEB-INF/lib");
293        if (jars == null) {
294            jars = Collections.emptySet();
295        }
296        String path = null;
297        Iterator<?> paths = jars.iterator();
298        while (paths.hasNext()) {
299
300            path = paths.next().toString();
301            if (!path.endsWith(".jar")) {
302                continue;
303            }
304            URL resourceURL = null;
305            try {
306                URL jarURL = context.getResource(path);
307                resourceURL = new URL("jar:"
308                                      + translate(jarURL.toExternalForm())
309                                      + "!/META-INF/chain-config.xml");
310                InputStream is = null;
311                try {
312                    is = resourceURL.openStream();
313                } catch (Exception e) {
314                      // means there is no such resource
315                }
316                if (is == null) {
317                    if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
318                        log.debug("Not Found: " + resourceURL);
319                    }
320                    continue;
321                } else {
322                    is.close();
323                }
324                if (log.isDebugEnabled()) {
325                    log.debug("Parsing: " + resourceURL);
326                }
327                parser.parse(catalog, resourceURL);
328            } catch (Exception e) {
329                throw new RuntimeException("Exception parsing chain config resource '"
330                     + resourceURL.toExternalForm() + "': "
331                     + e.getMessage());
332            }
333        }
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Translate space character into {@code %20} to avoid problems
338     * with paths that contain spaces on some JVMs.
339     *
340     * @param value Value to translate
341     *
342     * @return the translated value
343     */
344    private String translate(String value) {
345        while (true) {
346            int index = value.indexOf(' ');
347            if (index < 0) {
348                break;
349            }
350            value = value.substring(0, index) + "%20" + value.substring(index + 1);
351        }
352        return value;
353    }
354}
